actives.name: Jacob Resler
actives.why: I wanted to connect with more people in the College of Engineering who I could learn from and spend time with.
actives.what: It's been amazing to transition from asking for advice to being asked for advice from my brothers, and I'll always treasure the relationships I've made with people thanks to joining TT.
actives.about: I'm a senior in Mechanical Engineering and was accepted into the BS/MS program in Materials, so I'll be around SB for another year. Aside from driving myself crazy with school, I spend my time hiking and biking (road or mountain) and generally spending time away from my desk! I also dabble in coffee and craft brewing.

actives.name: ChanChan Mao
actives.why: I joined Theta Tau to meet new people with similar interests and like-minded goals.
actives.what: I love that there are so many brothers I can go to for advice or just to talk to.
actives.about: I am originally from the Bay Area and lived there for 19 years until my family suddenly moved to New Jersey, so I don't really have a "hometown" anymore.

actives.name: Destin Wong
actives.why: For the people!
actives.what: The culture and the community.
actives.about: I'm a 4th year electrical engineer who enjoys reading, video games, and sleeping :)).

actives.name: Ethan Luu
actives.why: I joined Theta Tau because I wanted to meet and build bonds with like-minded individuals and learn more from the experiences of the brothers.
actives.what: I really enjoy Theta Tau because it allowed me to meet some of my closes friends at UCSB and offered support in helping me develop professionally and academically.
actives.about: In my free time, I love to work out, play videogames, and skate.

actives.name: Julian Wong
actives.why: I joined Theta Tau to make friends!
actives.what: Everyone is amazing and so willing to help. Engineering can be really difficult but having so many people around that are fun and supportive make it a lot better!
actives.about: I am the scribe for the sigep chapter of TT! I'm a 3rd year CS major and some of my hobbies are working out, playing games, and reading.

actives.name: Ken Kuboshima
actives.why: After being unsuccessful at rushing a social frat, I tried rushing Theta Tau and I happened to really like everyone I talked to.
actives.what: I really enjoy hanging out with my bros, but frankly that's been limited due to COVID.
actives.about: A COE undergrad working on a BS in Mechanical Engineering, a total nerd for aerospace and rocketry, TT Regent for the 2020-2021 COVID year

actives.name: Adarsh Garg
actives.why: I joined Theta Tau to meet new people with similar goals and interests and have a better balance between my social and professional college life.
actives.what: Getting advice from brothers/alumni and making new friends.
actives.about: I'm a huge Lakers fan, like to listen to music, and really enjoy watching TV shows and movies.

actives.name: Cindy Zhao
actives.why: To make connections with like-minded individuals and to meet more people in engineering.
actives.what: Making friends and lifelong connections!
actives.about: Some of my hobbies are baking, hiking, and watching random things on Netflix.

actives.name: Justin Lin
actives.why: I wanted to meet more people in engineering.
actives.what: It's a good balance between a social and professional environment. The people I met really changed my life for the better and made college more enjoyable!
actives.about: I like to surf and game as in my free time.

actives.name: Shaun Chen
actives.why: To make connections with other engineering major students that I can take beyond my 4 years at UCSB.
actives.what: I love the support system that I've made both academically and socially!
actives.about: I love traveling, video games, cinematography, minimalist aesthetics, and all the little innovative gadgets in the tech space!

actives.name: Zion Wang
actives.why: Because I wanted more connections
actives.what: The camaraderie
actives.about: I like to surf and listen to One Direction. Directioner for life.

actives.name: Ashley Wang
actives.why: I joined Theta Tau because I wanted the opportunity to meet people from different engineering disciplines and be able to learn and appreciate the different strengths and goals of varying engineering disciplines.
actives.what: I really love the people in Theta Tau, and I really like that we're able to spend time together both in a professional and social settings. Most of my closest friends are people I met through TT, and I'll always be grateful for that.
actives.about: I really love the people in Theta Tau, and I really like that we're able to spend time together both in a professional and social settings. Most of my closest friends are people I met through TT, and I'll always be grateful for that.

actives.name: Chiyo McMullin
actives.why: To make more engineering friends :')
actives.what: Everyone is super welcoming and passionate!
actives.about: I love thrifting and chilling on the beach. I also love Minecraft parodies.

actives.name: Ethan Mader
actives.year: Second Year Computer Science and Math
actives.why: I joined TT to make lasting friendships and build a sense of community within the College of Engineering.
actives.what: I enjoy being able to get closer to others with diverse STEM interests and get mentorship for my academics.
actives.about: I am a first year student with a passion for math and computer science. I have diverse interests including tennis, chess, juggling, unicycling, and Rubik's cubes. When I'm not being a massive nerd I enjoy letting loose and playing Lego Star Wars TCS on Wii.

actives.name: Heather Dinh
actives.why: I joined Theta Tau to meet cool engineering majors with similar interests!
actives.what: I like how TT is a great balance between a professional and social fraternity. Everyone I've met has been really friendly and supportive, and I enjoy spending time with the brothers.
actives.about: I'm a second year CS major and love hanging out with friends and playing tennis. I also grew up playing music, so I spend a lot of time listening to Spotify (mostly r&b and pop), and jamming on the guitar/piano.

actives.name: Ishaan Nagpal
actives.why: I joined Theta Tau to create lifelong bonds and connections with engineers.
actives.what: I enjoy making memories with my brothers :)
actives.about: I enjoy making memories with my brothers :)

actives.name: Jake Yim
actives.why: To make new personal and professional relationships with like-minded people.
actives.what: Making lifelong friends and meeting new people who I can relate to.
actives.about: In my free time, I like going on walks, playing basketball with friends, drawing, and watching anime.

actives.name: Jonathan Lorenzo
actives.why: I wanted to see what connections and opportunities Theta Tau can offer.
actives.what: The people I've meet in the brotherhood. Each one of them so unique, and fun to talk to. Theta Tau really shift my perspective on college.
actives.about: I'm a nerd by heart. I enjoy video games, Dungeon & Dragons, and foam smithing.

actives.name: Khalid Mihlar
actives.why: I joined Theta Tau due to the profession nature of its members, and the strong brotherhood the active body presents for one another.
actives.what: The best part of TT is definitely the active body. For me personally, I feel comfortable talking to any of the actives. Everyone in this professional fraternity showcases a bond of fraternal friendship to each other, creating a strong brotherhood within the members that can be seen between any of the active body.
actives.about: My name is Khalid Mihlar. I am a somewhat energetic human who has way to many interests in video games and pop culture media. I can safely say the best part of life is having the most random moments of life occur with the right people!

actives.name: Lara Floegel-Shetty
actives.why: I joined Theta Tau after talking to some of the actives before and I really liked them and wanted to get to know everyone better.
actives.what: I really enjoy getting to know everyone and forming friendships that I know will last a lifetime.
actives.about: I love going on spontaneous adventures with friends, working out, drawing and playing with my dog Finn.

actives.name: Lina Zeng
actives.why: To find and connect with more individuals in engineering
actives.what: Making friends & memories
actives.about: My mission is to create safe spaces for everyone to be themselves, make mistakes, learn, and grow. In my free time, you can likely find me playing board games, creating art, or finding a snack to eat.

actives.name: Koki Narimoto
actives.why: I joined Theta Tau to meet more like minded engineering students at UCSB and to make more meaningful professional and personal connections.
actives.what: The members are extremely friendly and motivate/encourage me to work harder! Also, there are some cool people lol
actives.about: Friends & Family, Traveling, Basketball, and Thrifting/Clothes

actives.name: Matthew Tom
actives.why: To meet people in engineering and gain more professional knowledge about my major to give me more direction.
actives.what: Getting to talk to my pledge brothers and getting more professional advice about my major.
actives.about: I was born in Pasadena, but I forget so I just say Arcadia. I enjoy reading comics (any type), going out for runs, and Legos. I am trying to get better at playing the bagpipes, so if anyone knows how to tune highland bagpipes please hit me up. I enjoy listening to any type of music as long as it sounds good.

actives.name: Maya Fussell
actives.why: I joined Theta Tau to meet people with similar interests and passions that I can connect with both academically and socially.
actives.what: I love that I can go to anyone in the organization with a problem I’m struggling with, whether its personal, professional, or social, and they would be more than happy to help me out. I’ve made some of my closest friends through the org, as well as lifelong memories.
actives.about: When I’m not catching up on the lectures that I accidentally slept through, I love gaming, beach volleyball, skateboarding, and getting overly invested in arguments about the best type of alternative milk (in case you were wondering, it's clearly oat.)

actives.name: Michael Howo
actives.why: I wanted to get to know more of my fellow engineering students.
actives.what: I really enjoy being part of this great community of engineers. I think it is a really good balance of a social and academic environment.
actives.about: I am a second year Mechanical Engineering major. In my free time I like to play chess, skate around campus, and hang out with friends!

actives.name: Rutvik Jha
actives.why: I joined Theta Tau to meet like-minded, driven engineers.
actives.what: I enjoy, most, the people that I have met through Theta Tau. They are talented, ambitious, and endlessly supportive.
actives.about: I am a Computer Engineering student by passion. In my free time, I enjoy hiking on local trails, and I enjoy playing music.

actives.name: Sahil Naik
actives.why: I joined Theta Tau for the professional experience and creating a strong brotherhood with people of similar social, academic, and professional interests.
actives.what: My favorite part about Theta Tau is that despite being unique in our own ways, all of our brothers have an insane amount of similarities. Whether that be work ethic or social lives, I personally feel as if there are several ways I can bond and have fun with all my brothers.
actives.about: I love hanging out with friends and going out on random spontaneous adventures. Im also a pretty big tech nerd and love video games and anything software related.

actives.name: Justin Chang
actives.why: I joined Theta Tau to expand my network and make new friends.
actives.what: I love the fact that I am able to surround myself with like-minded engineers, especially since the engineering department at UCSB is so small.
actives.about: In my free time, I enjoy backpacking, playing video games, and spending time with my friends.
